^^1^^And it came to pass in those days that there was a great lamentation, for Malyce Graves had died.
^^2^^Lo, even after death, the frantic scribblings continued unabated, and word after word spilled forth from the gaping maw of that unholy sepulcher. Scribbles like many had yet seen, though few believed.
^^3^^ For, in their heart of hearts, the readers knew that these words were the ravings of a broken, yet cunningly demented mind.

Hi! I'm Malyce and I write stuff. 

You can most often find me in the [https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/chat-guide SCP IRC] as MalyceGraves, or you can follow me on Twitter [https://twitter.com/MalyceG @MalyceG].

Do enjoy!

++++ [[span style="font-family: 'Nanum Brush Script', cursive; color: #390000; font-size: 150%"]]I <3 the Circus[[/span]]
This tale series is the introduction of a few new Circus characters. While it isn't explicit throughout the story (so far), the Protagonist eventually attains the name Cahaya. The relationship between Cahaya and Fraust is really the first thing I've added to the site, and I'm quite glad that the first thing I put in is a love story. It starts with the I <3 the Circus, and then ends with [https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-4459 SCP-4459: The Ringmaster's Crown]. Time is funky, because in my headcanon, the Kaleidoscope allows for opening Ways into the past. 

Some of the feedback I've gotten has been about how forced the gender stuff appears. Cahaya is meant to be whatever gender you assign to them. I wanted it to be very fluid on that. Also, Fraust is a Clown, and can change their gender at will. Sooo, yeah. Gender fluidity is deeply personal to me, and I wanted to showcase that in my stories about these people.

I'd like to dedicate all of these stories to my beloved boyfriend. He's an acrobat/contortionist/aerialist in the real-world circus, and my love for him is intermixed with my love of Herman Fuller's Circus. Thank you for being such a light in my life, and for your unfailing love and support. You give me the strength to continue, to be better, to be worthy. <3

++++ [[span style="font-family: 'Nanum Brush Script', cursive; color: #390000; font-size: 150%"]]SCP-5501: Empty Portraits[[/span]]
This represents a significant amount of research into the American Civil War as well as the impact of that conflict upon the mental health of the people that participated. As one of the bloodiest periods of my nation's history, the impact of that war has etched itself deeply upon the collective psyche of the people that survived it and the descendants.

I am a first generation American. Both sides of my parental lineage stretch far back through centuries of conflict and death, so while I cannot say that the echoes of the American Civil War still ring in my blood, I see the horrors of my own cultural legacy mirrored in it.

While I am excited to write fiction about these events, I think it is tremendously important to keep in mind that these events happened. There is no horror that I can craft in the comfort of my office chair that will ever match the horror experienced by the people that fought and died in that war, or any war. Out of respect, I have kept as close to the source material as possible.

All of the officers mentioned here are real people. The battles and dates of the battles mentioned here are real. The only one that wasn't is "Massacre at Seven Pines", that is entirely of my creation. The horror of The Battle of The Crater is real, and the racism that added to that needless slaughter was also real.

Let us not forget that this war was fought, and a great many people died, for the "right" of the Southern States to own slaves. This horrific stain on my Nation's history must never be forgotten lest we become complacent, and thus complicit, in the practice of trafficking and sale of human beings all around the globe.
[[/tab]]
